name: BGK Ortho 5×12 2×2U
author: Barnaby Kendall

There are five layers:

  • 􀅯 — Default alphanumeric keys
  • 􀃉 — Number layer (bottom left green legends
  • 􀗢 — Function (Fn) layer (top left orange legends)
  • 􀃫 — Number Pad (NP) (bottom right blue legends)
  • 􀍱 — Meta layer (bottom purple legends)

Notes:

  • Encoder can replace leftmost key on one of the top three rows (currently the topmost row).
  • Grey legends indicate modifier when held.
  • Fn layer can be accessed from Default and NP layers.
  • NP layer is accessed by pressing 􀗢 while 􀃉 is held.
  • Meta layer is accessed by pressing 􀃉 while 􀗢 is held.
  • NP and Meta layers can be toggled on with three taps of the second layer key.
  • Unmarked letter and number keys on NP and Meta layers have no action. However…
  • Shift on NP layer is Shift+Default layer key for all keys (e.g., Shift+􀃢 is ‘*’).
  • Alt on Fn layer is Right Alt+Default layer key.
  • Application shortcuts on Meta layer are actually function keys that trigger HotKey App actions.
